_comment: Created by ianb on 08/10/2013 13:54:00 using v0.9
title: How have NHS staff sickness rates changed?
analysis_commentary: Sickness absence is subject to marked seasonal variation, with peaks in the late autumn/winter months and subsequent reductions. Absence rates reached a maximum of 4.8% in December 2010, with a minimum of 3.7% reported in May 2011. The national rate fell from 4.38% in 2009/10 to 4.12% in 2011/12, but rose to 4.24% on average in 2012/13.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Sickness Absence Rates in the NHS. Department of health, Survey of NHS staff
